definitions.definition: Someone or something that creates marks , particularly

subdefinitions.definition: A felt-tipped pen , a marker pen .
examples: Don't use the permanent marker on the whiteboard .

subdefinitions.definition: A scorekeeper , especially one who tallies billiard scores .
A device that fires a paintball .

definitions.definition: Someone or something used to mark a position or amount , particularly

subdefinitions.definition: A real or virtual objective , something to be aimed for.

A location on a stage or set where an actor is to stand or move to during a scene, usually indicated by a small X design placed on the floor. A direction issued by a camera operator for actors to be on their locations in readiness for a take.
Synonym of IOU , an informal record of a debt .
A free or bound morpheme indicating a grammatical function .
A gene or DNA sequence with a known location on a chromosome that can be used to identify individuals or species .
A substance used as an indicator for diagnosis or other analysis , a biomarker .
The soldier who forms the pilot of a wheeling column or marks the direction of an alignment .
A sewing machine attachment that creases the fabric to mark a line
A counter , especially one used in card games or backgammon .
Any of various objects that mark a place on the landscape , such as a milepost , blaze , or surveyor's cairn .

definitions.definition: Someone who assigns marks on tests , examinations , etc.; a grader .
The ink marks or residue of a felt-tipped pen .
examples: Susie got marker all over the walls.

definitions.definition: A personal favor owed to someone , whether written or not .
examples: We may not be able to do this alone. Maybe it’s time to call in some of our markers .

definitions.definition: A formal certification that a company was the first to approach a competition authority to reveal the existence of a cartel , generally entitling it to greater leniency during the cartel 's dissolution and punishment .
A player on defense used to mark one or more offensive players .
A player employed by a private club to compete against members .
A point , unit of scoring in a game or competition .

main_definition: Someone or something that creates marks , particularly
secondary_definitions: Someone or something used to mark a position or amount , particularly
( UK ) Someone who assigns marks on tests , examinations , etc.; a grader .
( uncountable , colloquial ) The ink marks or residue of a felt-tipped pen .
( figurative ) A personal favor owed to someone , whether written or not .

( competition law ) A formal certification that a company was the first to approach a competition authority to reveal the existence of a cartel , generally entitling it to greater leniency during the cartel 's dissolution and punishment .
( sports ) A player on defense used to mark one or more offensive players .
( dated ) A player employed by a private club to compete against members .
( Philippines , informal , basketball , volleyball ) A point , unit of scoring in a game or competition .
